metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition

requirements.description: This Section applies to heating and air-conditioning equipment in buildings
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to heating and air-conditioning equipment in buildings

requirements.description: Every dwelling unit shall be provided with heating equipment capable of maintaining interior temperature of 22 degrees C
requirements.exact_quote: Every dwelling unit shall be provided with heating equipment capable of maintaining interior temperature of 22 degrees C when the outdoor temperature is at the design temperature

requirements.description: Minimum interior design temperature for heating systems
requirements.exact_quote: capable of maintaining interior temperature of 22 degrees C

requirements.description: January 2.5% design temperature for Calgary
requirements.exact_quote: The January 2.5% design temperature for Calgary is -33 degrees C

requirements.description: Gas-fired furnaces shall conform to CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 236 or CGA 2.3
requirements.exact_quote: Gas-fired furnaces shall conform to CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 236 or CGA 2.3

requirements.description: Boilers shall conform to CSA B51
requirements.exact_quote: Boilers shall conform to CSA B51

requirements.description: Heat pumps shall conform to CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 236 or CSA C656
requirements.exact_quote: Heat pumps shall conform to CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 236 or CSA C656

requirements.description: Heating equipment shall be installed in locations that provide adequate access for service and maintenance
requirements.exact_quote: Heating equipment shall be installed in locations that provide adequate access for service and maintenance

requirements.description: Minimum clearance in front of furnace for service access
requirements.exact_quote: A clearance of not less than 600 mm shall be provided in front of heating equipment for service access

requirements.description: Heating equipment shall have clearances from combustible materials as specified by the manufacturer or applicable standard
requirements.exact_quote: Heating equipment shall have clearances from combustible materials as specified by the manufacturer or applicable standard

requirements.description: Wood-burning stoves shall conform to CAN/CSA-B415.1
requirements.exact_quote: Wood-burning stoves shall conform to CAN/CSA-B415.1

requirements.description: Pellet-burning appliances shall conform to CAN/CSA-B415.1
requirements.exact_quote: Pellet-burning appliances shall conform to CAN/CSA-B415.1

requirements.description: Minimum clearance from sides and back of solid-fuel-burning appliance to combustible walls (unless reduced by approved protection)
requirements.exact_quote: Solid-fuel-burning appliances shall have a clearance of not less than 900 mm from combustible walls unless reduced by approved protection methods

requirements.description: Solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be installed on noncombustible floor protection extending appropriate distances
requirements.exact_quote: Solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be installed on noncombustible floor protection

requirements.description: Oil-burning equipment shall conform to CAN/CSA-B140 series
requirements.exact_quote: Oil-burning equipment shall conform to CAN/CSA-B140 series

requirements.description: Indoor oil storage tanks shall conform to CAN/ULC-S601
requirements.exact_quote: Indoor oil storage tanks shall conform to CAN/ULC-S601

requirements.description: Maximum capacity for indoor oil storage tanks
requirements.exact_quote: Indoor oil storage tanks shall not exceed 2500 L capacity

requirements.description: Gas-burning equipment shall conform to CAN/CSA-B149.1, Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code
requirements.exact_quote: Gas-burning equipment shall conform to CAN/CSA-B149.1

requirements.description: Gas piping shall conform to CAN/CSA-B149.1
requirements.exact_quote: Gas piping shall conform to CAN/CSA-B149.1

requirements.description: Electric heating equipment shall conform to the Canadian Electrical Code
requirements.exact_quote: Electric heating equipment shall conform to the Canadian Electrical Code

requirements.description: Minimum clearance between baseboard heaters and floor covering
requirements.exact_quote: Baseboard heaters shall be installed with not less than 12 mm clearance from floor covering

requirements.description: Ducts for heating and cooling systems shall be constructed of galvanized steel, aluminum, or other approved materials
requirements.exact_quote: Ducts for heating and cooling systems shall be constructed of galvanized steel, aluminum, or other approved materials

requirements.description: Return air ducts shall conform to CAN/ULC-S110
requirements.exact_quote: Return air ducts shall conform to CAN/ULC-S110

requirements.description: Ducts shall be sized to deliver required airflow without excessive pressure drop or noise
requirements.exact_quote: Ducts shall be sized to deliver required airflow without excessive pressure drop or noise

requirements.description: Ducts in unconditioned spaces shall be insulated to minimum RSI 0.88
requirements.exact_quote: Ducts in unconditioned spaces shall be insulated to minimum RSI 0.88

requirements.description: Minimum thermal resistance for duct insulation in unconditioned spaces
requirements.exact_quote: minimum RSI 0.88

requirements.description: Fuel-burning appliances shall be vented to the outdoors unless listed for unvented use
requirements.exact_quote: Fuel-burning appliances shall be vented to the outdoors unless listed for unvented use

requirements.description: Factory-built chimneys shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629
requirements.exact_quote: Factory-built chimneys shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629

requirements.description: Gas vents shall conform to CAN/ULC-S636
requirements.exact_quote: Gas vents shall conform to CAN/ULC-S636

requirements.description: Minimum height of vent termination above roof surface within 3 m of termination
requirements.exact_quote: Vent terminations shall extend not less than 600 mm above any portion of the roof within 3 m

requirements.description: Minimum height of vent termination above roof line
requirements.exact_quote: Vent terminations shall extend not less than 300 mm above the roof line
